intro: Sisymbrium weberbaueri, commonly known as Weberbauer's broomrape, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a hemiparasitic plant, meaning it partially relies on host plants for water and nutrients while performing photosynthesis. The plant lacks chlorophyll and has a distinctive appearance with yellow flowers and a branched stem. It is native to regions of Central Asia and is often found growing on the roots of grasses and other herbaceous plants. Due to its parasitic nature, it plays a unique role in ecosystem dynamics and is of interest to botanists studying plant interactions.
